put.desc: Asynchronously creates a new storage account with the specified parameters. Existing accounts cannot be updated with this API and should instead use the Update Storage Account API. If an account is already created and subsequent PUT request is issued with exact same set of properties, then HTTP 200 would be returned.

params.name: resourceGroupName
params.desc: The name of the resource group within the user's subscription.

params.name: accountName
params.desc: The name of the storage account within the specified resource group. Storage account names must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

params.name: parameters
params.desc: The parameters to provide for the created account.

delete.desc: Deletes a storage account in Microsoft Azure.

params.name: resourceGroupName
params.desc: The name of the resource group within the user's subscription.

params.name: accountName
params.desc: The name of the storage account within the specified resource group. Storage account names must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

get.desc: Returns the properties for the specified storage account including but not limited to name, account type, location, and account status. The ListKeys operation should be used to retrieve storage keys.

params.name: resourceGroupName
params.desc: The name of the resource group within the user's subscription.

params.name: accountName
params.desc: The name of the storage account within the specified resource group. Storage account names must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

patch.desc: Updates the account type or tags for a storage account. It can also be used to add a custom domain (note that custom domains cannot be added via the Create operation). Only one custom domain is supported per storage account. This API can only be used to update one of tags, accountType, or customDomain per call. To update multiple of these properties, call the API multiple times with one change per call. This call does not change the storage keys for the account. If you want to change storage account keys, use the RegenerateKey operation. The location and name of the storage account cannot be changed after creation.

params.name: resourceGroupName
params.desc: The name of the resource group within the user's subscription.

params.name: accountName
params.desc: The name of the storage account within the specified resource group. Storage account names must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

params.name: parameters
params.desc: The parameters to update on the account. Note that only one property can be changed at a time using this API.

post.desc: Lists the access keys for the specified storage account.

params.name: resourceGroupName
params.desc: The name of the resource group.

params.name: accountName
params.desc: The name of the storage account.

get.desc: Lists all the storage accounts available under the given resource group. Note that storage keys are not returned; use the ListKeys operation for this.

params.name: resourceGroupName
params.desc: The name of the resource group within the user's subscription.
